string reason

Returns
Type Description

| Edit this page View Source

BanUnder(StoopidTime, string?, StoopidTime?)

Allows you to ban users that have been in the server for a certain amount of time.

Declaration
[Cmd("BanUnder")]
[Aliases("BanUnder")]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[BotPerm(GuildPermission.BanMembers)]
public Task BanUnder(StoopidTime time, string? option = null, StoopidTime? time1 = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
StoopidTime time

The amount of time. Formatted as {0}mo{1}d{2}h{3}m{4}s
string option

Allows you to specify -accage to check account age rather than server age, or -p to preview the users to ban.
StoopidTime time1

Allows you to specify a time range.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Examples

.banunder 1mo

.banunder 1mo -accage 1d

.banunder 1mo -p

Declaration

Parameters
Type Name Description
ITextChannel channel

The text channel where the message is located
ulong messageId

The ID of the message to delete
StoopidTime time

Optional time duration after which the message should be deleted
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command requires the caller to have ChannelPermission.ManageMessages.

Examples

.delete #channel 123456789012345678

Delmsgoncmd(Channel, State, ITextChannel)

Sets the state of deleting messages on command execution for a specific channel.

Declaration

[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[BotPerm(GuildPermission.ManageMessages)]
[Priority(0)]
public Task Delmsgoncmd(Administration.Channel _, Administration.State s, ITextChannel ch)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Administration.Channel _

Unused parameter
Administration.State s

The state to set for deleting messages on command execution
ITextChannel ch

The channel where the state should be applied
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command requires the caller to have GuildPermission.Administrator and the bot to have GuildPermission.ManageMessages.

Examples

.delmsgoncmd enable #channel

.delmsgoncmd disable #channel

NameBan(string)

Allows you to ban users with a specific name. This command will show a preview of the users that will be banned. Takes a regex pattern as well.

Declaration
[Cmd("NameBan")]
[Aliases("NameBan")]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[BotPerm(GuildPermission.BanMembers)]
public Task NameBan(string name)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string name

The name or regex pattern you want to use.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Examples

.nameban name

.nameban ^[a-z]{3,16}$

SetNick(IGuildUser, string?)

Lets you set the nickname for a mentioned user. If no user is mentioned it defaults to setting a nickname for the bot.

Declaration

[BotPerm(GuildPermission.ManageNicknames)]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.ManageNicknames)]
[Priority(1)]
public Task SetNick(IGuildUser gu, string? newNick = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IGuildUser gu

The target user.
string newNick

The new nickname. Provide none to reset.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Examples

.setnick @user newNick
